definition: to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
deficiency/lack/scarce/vacant post/to run short of

sentences.english: Being traditional does not mean being old-fashioned or outmoded.
sentences.chinese: 保持傳統並非意味着抱殘守缺或冥頑不化。

sentences.english: The Government, he said, were sticking to stale ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他說政府仍在抱殘守缺。

sentences.english: The Qing government was conservative diehards against the reformers change.
sentences.chinese: 清政府頑固派卻抱殘守缺，反對維新變革。

sentences.english: Being happy doesn't have to mean that everything is perfect but rather you are looking beyond the imperfections.
sentences.chinese: 開心並非是指事事完美無缺，而是你不再抱殘守缺。

definition: lit. enough books to make a pack-ox sweat or to fill a house to the rafters (idiom); fig. many books
to change progressively
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
humanism
attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
hidebound by convention (idiom)
to make painstaking efforts (idiom); after much trouble/to work hard at sth
utilitarianism
outmoded conventions/old-fashioned ways
nihilism
political relations
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to become a mere formality
famous school/noted school of thought
